reviews.review_msg: This is one of the most fun, entertaining, and easy courses I have taken. During labs, you are free to test code, ask questions, and chat with Prof. Sneddon. As someone who HATES coding this class is super fun mostly because of the prof and the creative freedom for the last assignment. The prof is so nice, funny, and genuinely enjoys teaching

Prof. Sneddon is probably one of my new top 3 professors. She's super helpful and approachable, and she really does try to connect with each student. She knows everyone's names in labs and things you've talked about. She explains the codes and homework step by step if you're struggling. I'm 100% gonna take courses later on just bc she teaches it!!

Prepare to teach yourself how to code (Bash, Python, R). While MBB222 isn't technically a prerequisite, it will make more sense if you have some biochem knowledge. She doesn't actually teach you how to code. The only reason I know anything for this class is from Datacamp and Youtube. Labs are hard to do since you haven't learned coding. Hard exams
